item.title: Reviving Indian Economy
item.description: The increase in Gross Domestic Product (GDP) is a parameter to measure the country’s economic growth. The GDP is defined as the combined value of all goods and services produced in a country annually.

item.title: The Bleeding Indian Economy
item.description: Let’s go back 90 years in the year 1929 - the year when all across the world the stock markets had crashed down heavily and the world was staring at the worst recession ever.

item.title: Worrying state of the Indian economy at 5% GDP growth
item.description: Indian economy is heading towards a winter recession in a state of trepidation. Anybody who thinks that we are not facing a serious economic crisis is turning a blind eye.

item.title: The Economic Slowdown - How well is India prepared?
item.description: For the time being, Kashmir and Article 370 can take a back seat. There is a more serious business to be taken care of. A heavy debate is going on in the country about one of the worst economic slow-down in probably more than four decades.

item.title: The Fading Glitter of Gold
item.description: All that glitters is not gold NOW for a common man. The yellow metal prices continue to rise further touching a ₹40,000 mark today. How does gold affect the economy?
